data.title: One World Concert with Dalai Lama to feature 26 artists in 190 minutes, producers say little about schedule
data.meta_description: Once the Dalai Lama finishes speaking, that leaves about 7 minutes per artist.
data.text:
Syracuse -- Producers and promoters of the One World Concert scheduled for Tuesday at the Carrier Dome have said they believe the event is the biggest musical collaboration to ever roll through Central New York.

With 26 artists on the musical lineup, they might be right.

But producers have said little about the event’s schedule — who is performing with whom and for how long?

A list of frequently asked questions on the One World Concert's website says the event will be 7 to 11 p.m. and the Dalai Lama will speak for about 50 minutes.

That leaves three hours and 10 minutes for the music — or a little more than 7 minutes per artist. That’s not counting any time for the evening’s emcee, Whoopi Goldberg.

Here is a link to the scheduled performers.

The website goes on to say that each artist will perform at least one song. Some artists will perform together, according to the website.

Several artists plan to perform a joint song for the Dalai Lama, according to Mark Emery, spokesman for World Harmony Productions, the company producing One World Concert.

Emery could not say more about that collaboration, if musicians were bringing their own bands or give additional details about the event’s schedule.

SU students were able to purchase discounted $25 tickets and general admission tickets have sold for $35, $45 or $55. Tickets for seats in the first 15 rows cost $200.

As of Thursday afternoon, the event was not sold out.
